service: Describes the API operations for creating and managing Amazon Bedrock models.

operations.CreateModelCustomizationJob:
Creates a fine-tuning job to customize a base model.

You specify the base foundation model and the location of the training data. After the model-customization job completes successfully, your custom model resource will be ready to use. Training data contains input and output text for each record in a JSONL format. Optionally, you can specify validation data in the same format as the training data. Amazon Bedrock returns validation loss metrics and output generations after the job completes.

Model-customization jobs are asynchronous and the completion time depends on the base model and the training/validation data size. To monitor a job, use the GetModelCustomizationJob operation to retrieve the job status.

For more information, see Custom models in the Bedrock User Guide.
operations.CreateProvisionedModelThroughput:
Creates a provisioned throughput with dedicated capacity for a foundation model or a fine-tuned model.

For more information, see Provisioned throughput in the Bedrock User Guide.
operations.DeleteCustomModel: Deletes a custom model that you created earlier. For more information, see Custom models in the Bedrock User Guide.
operations.DeleteProvisionedModelThroughput: Deletes a provisioned throughput. For more information, see Provisioned throughput in the Bedrock User Guide.
operations.GetCustomModel: Get the properties associated with a Amazon Bedrock custom model that you have created.For more information, see Custom models in the Bedrock User Guide.
operations.GetFoundationModel: Get details about a Amazon Bedrock foundation model.
operations.GetModelCustomizationJob: Retrieves the properties associated with a model-customization job, including the status of the job. For more information, see Custom models in the Bedrock User Guide.
operations.GetModelInvocationLoggingConfiguration: Get the current configuration values for model invocation logging.
operations.GetProvisionedModelThroughput: Get details for a provisioned throughput. For more information, see Provisioned throughput in the Bedrock User Guide.
operations.ListCustomModels:
Returns a list of the custom models that you have created with the CreateModelCustomizationJob operation.

For more information, see Custom models in the Bedrock User Guide.
operations.ListFoundationModels: List of Amazon Bedrock foundation models that you can use. For more information, see Foundation models in the Bedrock User Guide.
operations.ListModelCustomizationJobs:
Returns a list of model customization jobs that you have submitted. You can filter the jobs to return based on one or more criteria.

For more information, see Custom models in the Bedrock User Guide.
operations.ListProvisionedModelThroughputs: List the provisioned capacities. For more information, see Provisioned throughput in the Bedrock User Guide.
operations.ListTagsForResource:
List the tags associated with the specified resource.

For more information, see Tagging resources in the Bedrock User Guide.
operations.PutModelInvocationLoggingConfiguration: Set the configuration values for model invocation logging.
operations.StopModelCustomizationJob: Stops an active model customization job. For more information, see Custom models in the Bedrock User Guide.
operations.TagResource: Associate tags with a resource. For more information, see Tagging resources in the Bedrock User Guide.
operations.UntagResource: Remove one or more tags from a resource. For more information, see Tagging resources in the Bedrock User Guide.
operations.UpdateProvisionedModelThroughput: Update a provisioned throughput. For more information, see Provisioned throughput in the Bedrock User Guide.

AccessDeniedException.base: The request is denied because of missing access permissions.

refs.LoggingConfig$textDataDeliveryEnabled: Set to include text data in the log delivery.
refs.LoggingConfig$imageDataDeliveryEnabled: Set to include image data in the log delivery.
refs.LoggingConfig$embeddingDataDeliveryEnabl: Set to include embeddings data in the log delivery.

refs.CreateProvisionedModelThroughputRequest$: Commitment duration requested for the provisioned throughput.

refs.CreateModelCustomizationJobRequest$custo: Enter a name for the custom model.
refs.ListCustomModelsRequest$nameContains: Return custom models only if the job name contains these characters.

refs.ModelCustomizationJobSummary$customizati: Specifies whether to carry out continued pre-training of a model or whether to fine-tune it. For more information, see Custom models.

refs.ListCustomModelsRequest$foundationModelA: Return custom models only if the foundation model ARN matches this parameter.

refs.FoundationModelSummary$modelLifecycle: Contains details about whether a model version is available or deprecated.

refs.FoundationModelLifecycle$status: Specifies whether a model version is available (ACTIVE) or deprecated (LEGACY.

refs.ListFoundationModelsResponse$modelSummar: A list of Amazon Bedrock foundation models.

refs.CreateModelCustomizationJobRequest$clien: Unique token value that you can provide. The GetModelCustomizationJob response includes the same token value.
refs.CreateProvisionedModelThroughputRequest$: Unique token value that you can provide. If this token matches a previous request, Amazon Bedrock ignores the request, but does not return an error.

refs.FoundationModelSummary$inferenceTypesSup: The inference types that the model supports.

refs.FoundationModelSummary$inputModalities: The input modalities that the model supports.
refs.FoundationModelSummary$outputModalities: The output modalities that the model supports.

ProvisionedModelSummary.base: Set of fields associated with a provisioned throughput.

ResourceNotFoundException.base: The specified resource ARN was not found. Check the ARN and try your request again.

refs.CreateModelCustomizationJobRequest$roleA: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an IAM role that Amazon Bedrock can assume to perform tasks on your behalf. For example, during model training, Amazon Bedrock needs your permission to read input data from an S3 bucket, write model artifacts to an S3 bucket. To pass this role to Amazon Bedrock, the caller of this API must have the iam:PassRole permission.

refs.CloudWatchConfig$largeDataDeliveryS3Conf: S3 configuration for delivering a large amount of data.

refs.OutputDataConfig$s3Uri: The S3 URI where the output data is stored.
refs.TrainingDataConfig$s3Uri: The S3 URI where the training data is stored.
refs.Validator$s3Uri: The S3 URI where the validation data is stored.

refs.ListProvisionedModelThroughputsRequest$s: The field to sort by in the returned list of provisioned capacities.

refs.ListModelCustomizationJobsRequest$sortBy: The field to sort by in the returned list of jobs.

refs.ListCustomModelsRequest$sortBy: The field to sort by in the returned list of models.

TooManyTagsException.base: The request contains more tags than can be associated with a resource (50 tags per resource). The maximum number of tags includes both existing tags and those included in your current request.
